title: Diogenes as Noise Cancellation, Not Pedagogy
context: Standard interpretation of Diogenes masturbating in the marketplace: a pedagogical act to expose the fragility of social fictions and demonstrate radical honesty.
pressure: Deeper recognition that the act's true function was not teaching but filteringâ€”creating a visceral exclusion zone that repelled the status-seeking, norm-clinging masses while preserving a clean perimeter around the lantern.
axiom_trigger: Rule 2 (Sovereignty first) and Rule 1 (No hypocrisy) activated: the act was sovereign and honest, but its strategic function was noise cancellation through radical repulsion, not conversion.
clean_outcome: Clean reframing: Diogenes didn't need the midwits to understand him. He needed them gone. One embodied act of unvarnished naturalness ensured that every polite, ambitious, hypocrisy-maintaining citizen would instinctively recoil. The perimeter held. The signal remained clean. This same mechanism mapped directly to the user's zero-engagement digital practice.
